title: Chair Model
description: Kevin and Andy team up to reclaim the stolen Dunder Mifflin parking spaces, which forces them into a showdown with the other four bosses of the office park. Meanwhile, Michael becomes fascinated by a woman modeling chairs in a catalog.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: W.B. Jones is renovating their offices and their construction crews are taking up some of the parking spaces we used to get.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So we had to park at a satellite parking lot over there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Which just means we get to see more of our lovely street. Tell them what we saw today Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh today, we saw a junk yard dog attacking the bones of a rotisserie chicken.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nature.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Been here nine years. Now all of a sudden I'm supposed to park half a mile away.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I lost a penny out of my loafers, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [sitting down, rubbing his feet] I will quit. As God as my witness, I will quit if this is not fixed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Some of us like the walk more than others.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [off screen] Hurts like hell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Michael who is looking at a chair catalog] Did you pick a new chair? It's been awhile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, when I first opened this catalog, I thought I was just going to be picking out a chair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But instead, you found something to distract you from ever picking out a chair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael started the process of selecting a new chair about three weeks ago. And normally I wouldn't care, but he promised me his old one. It's way better. It's one of these. [makes a shrrhhh sound of a chair moving downward as Pam slumps down] I really want it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up the catalog] Have you ever seen this woman?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The one in the really great mesh black high-back swivel chair?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at her smile. Those eyes, look at her eyes. She's got - I don't know what it is actually, she dresses like a professional and yet you know there is a side of her that could just curl up on a couch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Or in a great chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, maybe, but remember after my dinner party when I said that I was swearing off women?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I definitely remember your dinner party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think what I meant was that I was completely swearing off one woman. [whispers] Jan. I think that fate put this catalog in my hands.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually, I put the catalog in your hands 'cause you have to pick out a new chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is it like being single? I like it. I like starting each day with a sense of possibility. And I'm optimistic because every day I get a little more desperate and desperate situations yield the quickest results.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and gentleman, would you please open your supply catalogs and kindly turn to page 85. [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [on phone] Yo, is this his new chair?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] No, he hasn't picked one yet.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [on phone] Daat!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: When Pam gets Michael's old chair, I get Pam's old chair. Then I'll have two chairs. Only one to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am ready to start dating again. Getting back on the market. So, FYI, for those of you who are thinking about fixing me up with any of your friends, use the woman on page 85 as a template. That will be all.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I left my cell phone in my car.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Call us when you get there so we know you're OK. [Andy gets up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Kevin] Listen man, I am completely over Jan, so, would you set me up?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: If I had someone to set you up with Michael, then I'd take her for myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought that you were engaged?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nope. Stacy broke up with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whaaaat? God, that's terrible man. Eghh, she's crazy. Umm, are you still on good terms with any of her friends?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Not anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's a bitter situation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah... ugh. She's... [gets up and leaves] you don't deserve her. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sitting on Oscar's desk] Oh hello Oscar Mayer Weiner lover. I bet that you have a bunch of very liberal girl type friends that trust you implicitly because they know you'd never touch 'em, because of your condition. Umm...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have a friend who's single.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sandy. She's gorgeous and she's got a feisty personality, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm, I see, feisty. So she's not jolly or sassy? Not like a jolly, sassy opera singer?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Umm, no, she's a professional softball player.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oooo. Catcher or in field?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Umm I don't know Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is she a dress wearer or a pants wearer? Could we share a row boat? Could, could a row boat support her?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What are you asking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I'm being very clear what I'm asking. Would an average size row boat support her without capsizing? [silence] It bothers me that you're not answering the question.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, alright no, she can't fit in a row boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it, I knew it! I knew it Phyllis! OK!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is wrong with these people? I would do anything for them and they're just hanging me out to dry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dating shouldn't be hard for somebody like me, but it is and you know why? Because nobody here is willing to help me. Nothing would ever get done in this office without a formal request, would it? Well, fine. Here goes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't think that this is--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, now OK, I know that this is probably not appropriate, but I need help. Because I want to play ball with my kids before I get too old. And before that happens I need to get laid. And before that happens I need to be in love. And I don't wanna hear "Ahnnn... I can't help elhh la la." No. No. I'm a catch and I am not going to be the one who got away. So, this is what we're going to do. Dwight is going to hand out index cards and I want you all to write down the name of an eligible woman for me to date by the end of the day. No, by the end of the hour or you are fired.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [gets up from chair] Write legibly people.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Because of the construction at W.B. Jones, half of us have to park in the satellite lot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm..

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's like a ten minute walk.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, thirty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, look, I am in an assigned parking place in front, so... Alright, alright, alright, umm let me try to think about what it would be like to not have one. [thinks] OK, yes that would be bad.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That would be bad.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...So help us out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wish I could, but I can't. Well can, but won't. Should, maybe, but shorn't.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, please he-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What part of shorn't don't you understand, Kevin? Look I could probably handle it, yes, but I think it would be a good exercise for you guys to do it yourselves.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We won't let you down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh you can't because I don't care. Listen, [Kevin and Andy high five as they leave Michael's office] don't forget to fill out those cards. My love cards.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: There's nobody I hate enough to write her name on this card.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, I'm setting Michael up with my fat friend anyway, he can just deal with it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Who are you putting down?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, you don't know her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your mom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, whatever. [Jim holds up the card] [Pam laughs] Give it to me. Give it to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, Wendy. Hot and juicy red head. Give this a try. [Michael dials phone number. Phone rings.]

quotes.speaker: Wendy's Phone Operator
quotes.text: Wendy's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello Wendy, this is Kevin's friend, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Wendy's Phone Operator
quotes.text: This isn't Wendy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry, could you put her on please?

quotes.speaker: Wendy's Phone Operator
quotes.text: Dude, this is a Wendy's restaurant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under breath] Damn it Kevin. OK, umm, could I just have a frosty and a baked potato please?

quotes.speaker: Wendy's Phone Operator
quotes.text: You have to come to the restaurant to order food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I'll send somebody to come pick it up. Just have it ready.

quotes.speaker: Wendy's Phone Operator
quotes.text: It's ready now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well put it aside. [hangs up the phone] [Dwight enters] Umm... yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I have collected the rest of the ladies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Good because this batch was awful. Umm... this one says chair model...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wrote that. Michael, you shouldn't have to settle. This is my pledge to you. I will find her and I will bring her to you and as God as my witness, she shall bear your fruit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That sounds good. [both smile] Go get her. Wa-Wait, wait, wait, wait. First, go to Wendy's, get my food. Come back and then go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] That is fantastic. Thank you, thank you very much. This is just what I needed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The furniture company gave me the name of the advertising agency. They gave me the name of the photographer. The photographer, a Spaniard, used a Wilkes-Barre modeling agency. The agency gave me the following information. [reads from notepad] Deborah Shoshlefski. 142 South Windsor Lane. Dead. Car accident. Case closed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She's dead? [Dwight makes knife slitting noise] She's so young.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She was so young and now she is dead. As dead as every dead animal who has ever died.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God. Oh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why don't you sit down? Michael... come on. [gets up and leads Michael to sit in his chair] Here we go. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, you didn't even know her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Try not to be so hurtful Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, how dare you. [Jim's face is in shock]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please, not at a time like this. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK Michael, you know what? I might have someone for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh really? What's her name? Burger King?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean it. [walks towards Michael] She's really nice and sweet and you guys might actually get along. [hands over card to Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't, I don't think I'm ready. Is she hot?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm setting Michael up with my land lady. She's really sweet and... whatever, I just can't take Michael like this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No question about it, I am ready to get hurt again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We need to assemble the five families.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [while brushing teeth with an electric toothbrush] No, not the five families.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We have to.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The five families are the five companies of Scranton Business Park. The bosses rarely meet. There's Michael Scott, Regional Manager, Dunder Mifflin. Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration. Paul Faust of Disaster Kits Limited. They call him "Cool Guy Paul." W.B. Jones of W.B. Jones Heating and Air. Grade A Bad Ass. And Bill Cress of Cress Tool and Dye. Bill Cress is super old and really mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [still brushing teeth] Sorry, I don't have time for this right now. I'm trying to get a date with Pam's hot friend. And she needs to meet me right now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Andy] I'm calling the meeting anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to cashier at coffee shop] Thank you very much. Our suspect has straight brown hair. She is wearing blue jeans and a black top. So... behold our bachelorette [cut to a blonde woman in a skirt]. Give her ten for looks and a three for her ability to describe herself. Hello, my lady. [woman walks right by and doesn't respond]

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [turns around to see the woman from his description] Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: Are you Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is who a Michael what?

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry, I'm, I'm supposed to be meeting someone named Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that's not, yeah I'm not... OK...

quotes.speaker: Coffee Shop Worker
quotes.text: Michael? Michael? [reads cup] Large hot chocolate with caramel and a shot of peppermint.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you get the rent checks every month and what happens next? What...

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: You're asking what I do with the checks that people write to me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just making conversation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why is it so hard to meet people? I... you know... it's uh... All I want is somebody nice and sweet and someone I can talk to and share an experience with, you know? Why is it so hard for people like us?

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You wanna see what I walked out on? This is gonna blow your mind. [holds up cell phone with a picture of Jan] Look at that.

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: She's beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, and you can't see her whole body. Down here, she's got a boob job. Just... she was just crazy smart and really manipulative and I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Michael? Hello? Michael? [Michael hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: I'm gonna head out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK. Well, umm... I enjoyed this conversation. It was very nice. It was like talking to the sweet old lady on the bus.

quotes.speaker: Margaret
quotes.text: That's incredibly rude.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now you ruined it. [gets up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Where's Scott?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh Michael Scott could not make it today due to an unforeseen prior engagement.

quotes.speaker: W.B. Jones
quotes.text: Let's just meet back in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gentleman please. We called this meeting. Andrew Bernard is the name of me. And this is my associate, Mr. Kevin Malone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [nervously stuttering] I... have... things...

quotes.speaker: W.B. Jones
quotes.text: Alright, what do you want?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well first of all, I'd just like to say [pulls out note cards] what an honor it is to be sitting here with you gentlemen.

quotes.speaker: W.B. Jones
quotes.text: You have about ten seconds--

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We want our parking spaces back!

quotes.speaker: Paul
quotes.text: Whose parking spaces?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: W.B. Jones' construction guys park in our parking spaces every morning and some people have to park really far away and walk all the way to the office. And some people sweat too much for comfort and--

quotes.speaker: Bill Cress
quotes.text: Ohh... God...

quotes.speaker: Paul
quotes.text: I don't have time for this you guys. [to W.B. Jones] Just give 'em back their spaces.

quotes.speaker: W.B. Jones
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Paul
quotes.text: We good? OK. Could have done this over e-mail.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: After Stacy left, things did not go well for awhile. And, and it was hard to see... [starts breaking up] It's just nice to win one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Margaret the land lady? Really Pam, is that what you think of me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's sweet and cute. I thought you'd get along.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK, Well I'm looking for a passionate affair, not companionship. I'm a man... of intensity, of, of cool and youth and, and passionately. God...[walks away back to his office]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [walks up to reception] Margaret?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You just got yourself kicked out of your apartment. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh I don't care, I didn't really like that place that much anyway. I'll just move.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh really? Who's gonna take you in? You're messy. You're a klutz, you spill everything. And you leave the volume on the TV way too loud.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, maybe I'll just move in with my boyfriend 'cause he's kind of a slob, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, sure. Let's do it. [Pam laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I umm, well I'm not gonna, I'm, I'm not gonna move in with anyone unless I'm engaged.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Have I not proposed to you, yet?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm, I don't, know...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, well, that's coming. [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, right now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. Not gonna do it right here, that would be rather lame.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, so then, when?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, I'm not gonna tell you. Hate to break it to you, but that's not how that works.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, right, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, I'm serious. It's happening.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh kay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And when it happens, it's going to kick your ass, Beesly. So... stay sharp.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I've been warned.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am not kidding. [shows camera an engagement ring] Got it a week after we started dating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know man. I was with Jan for so long. I was excited about meeting somebody new. Put my heart out there. It's just... [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what you need? Closure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're right. What do you mean though?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There was a woman in your life who affected you very deeply, and she left before you could say good bye. I think you need to say good bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. I'll drive.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We did it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [at same time as Kevin] I did it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We got our spaces back.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wow. [Stanley laughs and high fives Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. [fist bumps Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, there it is. You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did I do this for me? No, I did this for the little guy. For Joe Sixpack. The guy who wakes up every morning in his four hundred dollar a month apartment, wonders how's he gonna pay his mortgage that month. Wonders how he's gonna fill his car up with oil. Wonders how I'm gonna pay my kid's orphanage bills. That guy shouldn't have to wonder where he's gonna park.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking at the chair model's headstone] How did she die?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I guess you could say she died of blunt force trauma and blood loss. She got in a car accident and plowed into the side of an airplane hanger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She was so innocent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She was stoned apparently.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know I used to think that I had this perfect person out there waiting for me, but knowing that, that's just silly because she's dead. What do you do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wait until next year's chair catalog comes out and you find someone who's still alive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you move on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where do you want to go for dinner?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know, I kind of hate all our regular places right now. Oh, you know what [Jim gets down on one knee], that one...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Pam, will you wait for me one second while I tie my shoe?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiling] I hate you. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? My shoe is untied. What is your problem? [Pam laughs] Oh my God, you thought I wa-- oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How could I have thought that? How could I have thought that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Bye, bye, Ms. Chair Model lady. I dreamt that we were married and you treated me nice. We had lots of kids...drinking whiskey and rye, oh why'd you have to go off and die? Why'd you have to go off [with Dwight] and die?

quotes.speaker: {Michael}/{Dwight}
quotes.text: [singing] OH! You believe in rock 'n roll. Can music save your mortal soul? And then [jumbling up the words] can you have to dance real slow. Well, I know that you're in love with him. 'Cause I saw you dancing in the gym. [more jumbled words] 'You both kicked off your shoes. Those rhythm and blues...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Return.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Rhythm and blues...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This'll be [with Dwight] the day that I died.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is moving day.  I have spent the last month here at Dwight's lovely farm, taking a little bit of a vacation, clearing my head after Jan and I, um [Dwight puts his fingers to his head and makes a shooting noise] ssp... No, I did not kill her.  We were just at different places in our lives.  No, I thought I'd be the bigger man and allow her to stay at the condo.  She has since moved on; she is staying with her sister in Scottsdale.  Fresh outlook, and it's all good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, so look that over, make sure it's accurate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  What is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Your bill, minus the ten percent Dunder Mifflin corporate discount.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You were charging me?  I'm your friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You occupied the America room for six weeks.  That's our most popular room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There was no other guest the entire time I was here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right.  Because you were in the America room.  In an election year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  All right, Dwight.  Take my money.  Go ahead.  Keep in mind that this whole thing was just a business transaction.  The late nights, the talks, the slumber parties, the crying jags, that was all business, that had nothing to do with friendship, and being friends.  Just ring me up.  Go ahead [Dwight tears up bill].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We don't take debit cards, anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, little help with the bags, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, what about you, Angela?  Do you have any single friends?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A cute little religious type, someone who wears a uniform, or...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: A Catholic schoolgirl?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, obviously older.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: A nun?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Love.  Marriage.  Baby carriage.  Those have been my goals ever since I heard that song.  Jan and I had love.  We did not have marriage.  We did have a baby carriage, which I got her for bringing groceries home, after she got a DUI.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hi, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sitting at her desk] Hey, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.  Just hangin'.  Chillin'.  No agenda.  Would you consider hookin' me up with one of your friends?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, all my friends are crazy.  My one friend, Brianna...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, my God...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's hilarious.  What's her number?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She's 23.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm... nah, that's too young.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Actually, I know a ton of people that I can set you up with!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Some of my friends' parents, they're getting divorced now.  [Michael gets up and starts walking away] So I think some of those, like, older ladies, they're really looking for a guy to go on a date with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ['Rita Klondike 507' is written on an index card] All right, time's up!  Pencils down.  Please pass your future Mrs. Michael Scotts forward.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Forcing your employees to set you up is not a, uh, uh, technical violation of any Dunder Mifflin rule.  You know, but neither is forcing them to help you with a shot-by-shot remake of Indiana Jones.  Huh-how do you make a rule book like that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pammy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't have anybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't have one single girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not looking for a perfect 10 here, just somebody to hang out with.  Just fun, healthy young woman.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A kindergarten teacher, who is great with kids, maybe an ex-model, and now she wants to do something with her brain?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I don't, I...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How 'bout a professional volleyball player who models on the side?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, just a fun, guh, look, there, here, it doesn't have to be a model.  I'm not, don't rule out model, but just in terms of models, there are like twenty different categories.  There's face models, hand models, body models [Jim raises hand] - yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I actually know a sex model.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.  Yeah.  She's blind, is that a problem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I am, it's all about the personality, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you talking about Beverley?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because she's not a sex model.  She's a tollbooth operator.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Send me a picture.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So far, these are my leads.  A blind tollbooth operator and a twelve hundred pound catcher.  It's a start.
